messages.msgSnippet: i love your site, and it has linked me to some very helpful places. thanks so much.... right now im trying to decide if i wan t to spend 25$ on a mag. right
messages.messageBody:
i love your site, and it has linked me to some very helpful places. thanks so much.... right now im trying to decide if i wan t to spend 25$ on a mag. right now, or wait a bit, bc your right, i have tons of very intersting resources online.... thanks again for the link :)

SandraDodd@... wrote:I know nothing about Growler tapes, but I think Danielle Conger's on this
list, and I think Life Learning Magazine is good.

I think Danielle's site, Joyce Fetteroll's and mine probably have enough
information and links to other information to keep anyone reading for a year or
so, though. <g>

http://sandradodd.com/unschooling
(Joyce and Danielle are linked there too, and you already had Danielle's site
anyway.)

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] something i just read that i found helpful.(on spirited children)
messages.msgSnippet: I know nothing about Growler tapes, but I think Danielle Conger s on this list, and I think Life Learning Magazine is good. I think Danielle s site, Joyce
messages.messageBody:
I know nothing about Growler tapes, but I think Danielle Conger's on this
list, and I think Life Learning Magazine is good.

I think Danielle's site, Joyce Fetteroll's and mine probably have enough
information and links to other information to keep anyone reading for a year or
so, though. <g>

http://sandradodd.com/unschooling
(Joyce and Danielle are linked there too, and you already had Danielle's site
anyway.)

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] something i just read that i found helpful.(on spirited children)
messages.msgSnippet: One disadvantage to magazines is that they don t have the conversation aspect that email forums and lists have.  On a list or forum you can ask and answer
messages.messageBody:
One disadvantage to magazines is that they don't have the conversation aspect that email forums and lists have. On a list or forum you can ask and answer questions to further clarify or explain things.
Mary Ellen

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] something i just read that i found helpful.(on spirited children)
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m getting Life Learning Magazine and Live Free Learn Free magazine.  There is always something great and helpful in every issue.  A lot of it is stuff
messages.messageBody:
>>>>>>>>>and also im thinking of ordering Life Learning magazine, feedback??>>>>>>>>>>>>

I'm getting Life Learning Magazine and Live Free Learn Free magazine. There is always something great and helpful in every issue. A lot of it is stuff you can get on lists or boards, but the magazine format is easy to carry around and share with others.

Mary Ellen

messages.subject: something i just read that i found helpful.(on spirited children)
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.danielleconger.com/Homeschool/Highneed.html i kinda stumbled across this while searching for info that i could share with my lil boys grandma on
messages.messageBody:
http://www.danielleconger.com/Homeschool/Highneed.html

i kinda stumbled across this while searching for info that i could share with my lil boys grandma on unschooling, to begin to introduce her to the idea, shes had alot of questions.

ive read and now im rereading the book Raising your Spirited Child by Mary Sheedy Kurninka.

anyhow, im very glad ive found this group! :)

questions: anyone familiar with the Growler tapes? and also im thinking of ordering Life Learning magazine, feedback??
